mention.text: a useful , and even necessary , tool in curbing employee crime
A bill signed into law Monday by President Reagan
The new law , which becomes effective on Dec. 27 , bars pre-hiring polygraph screening and random testing , and it
workers suspected of a particular wrongdoing
many employers -- as well as many of the outside companies that typically administer the tests --
employers who have relied heavily on lie detectors
chairman of the Securities & Exchange Commission
the companies that actually administer the tests
president of New York Lie Detection Laboratories , a security-services firm whose clients include a number of brokerage houses
even the use of lie-detector tests when there has been a theft , which will still be permitted under the new law
an assistant dean at Georgetown University School of Medicine
Congress for the American Medical Association
John F. Beary , an assistant dean at Georgetown University School of Medicine
the director of enforcement at the SEC
some investment bankers who passed their polygraph tests with flying colors during insider-trading probes
Peter Persaud , who says he was denied a job as a vice president of Amerifirst Bank in Miami after twice flunking polygraph tests early this year
One banker who will be glad of the new restrictions
the young woman examiner who gave him the first test for Amerifirst
a former manager of a Zale Corp. jewelry store in Duluth , Ga.
